alert.note: Alert for Gregg (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 1:07PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Gregg, Harrison, Marion, Panola and Rusk. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Longview, Marshall, Kilgore, Hallsville, Jefferson, Tatum, Woodlawn, Harleton, Berea, Karnack, Elysian Fields, Deberry, Gray, Lakeport, Easton, Scottsville, Uncertain, Nesbitt, Darco and Chalk Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
